module.name: model_parameter
module.keywords: module, parameter, simulation model, product, category, schema, parameter assignment

abstract.li: the identification of a parameter for a model;
the identification of a parameter based on a schema;
the assignment of values to a parameter;
the assignment of a parameter to a model;
assignment of a parameter value to a product category;
assignment of a parameter value to a product in a category;
assignment of a parameter value based on a test method.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of information needed to describe model parameters, including simulation model parameters, a mechanism for overriding them and their assignments to products. Model parameters can be classified and may be assigned to product categories and to individual products within a category. A Model parameter may be based on an object or attribute in a formally defined schema. A parameter assignment may be based on a test method.

inscope.li: identification of a parameter for a model;
identification of a parameter based on a schema;
assignment of values to a model parameter;
assignment of a parameter to a model;
assignment of a parameter value to a product category;
assignment of a parameter value to a product in a category;
assignment of a parameter value based on a test method.
items within the scope of application module Activity method assignment, ISO/TS 10303-1249;
items within the scope of application module Characteristic, ISO/TS 10303-1654;
items within the scope of application module Classification with attributes, ISO/TS 10303-1111;
items within the scope of application module Group, ISO/TS 10303-1113;
items within the scope of application module Independent property representation, ISO/TS 10303-1038.
